modName: WARR - Weapon and Armor Recipes Rebalanced
summary:
Completely rebalances the recipe list of all vanilla weapons and armor.
For example, the Iron Shield clearly has a wooden frame yet doesn\'t require wood to craft. Well it does now...
descriptionHtml:
[color=red][center][b]WARR - Weapon and Armor Recipes Rebalanced[/b][/center][/color]
[center]by acdcdave1387[/center]
[center]Nexus exclusive, please let me know if you see my mods elsewhere[/center]
[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSbds.png[/img][/url][/center]
[color=yellow]\"Why? What do you mean by rebalance?\"[/color]
Well, I noticed how some of the weapons have wooden handles as well as some shields having a wooden frame and yet no recipes in game require wood. It is almost pointless to chop firewood in the game, so why add woodcutting in the first place?

This mod changes ALL default recipes in game for crafting Armor and Weapons to make more sense \"realistically.\" The Ingots and Leather pieces are quite small so the Armors require a lot more materials to craft, however to balance that out, the smaller pieces (ie, Helmet and Boots etc) cost a lot less. Many armor pieces have animal furs in them. The proper pelts/hides will be required for those. To make it easier, all smaller armor pieces (boots, helmet and gauntlets/bracers) use either Fox pelts or Wolf Pelts. Only the armors themselves use larger pelts such as Elk hide/ Sabrecat pelts/bear pelts.

As for the weapons, the vast majority of weapons cost less materials to craft themselves, but some have a few strange additions because you need to craft the Sheathes as well. Everything is based on the vanilla Visual representation so that weapons with an obvious wooden handle will require wood, and a sword with a leather scabbard will require leather. This means that weapons without a scabbard/sheathe (ie, two handed weapons) are easier to craft than ever.

I should note that for all Armors, the \"Visual Representaion\" used to configure \"realistic\" recipes was a Male Nord. Race shouldn\'t matter, but for female player characters the recipes might not make as much sense...ESPECIALLY if you are using a skimpy armor replacer.

~~Changelog~~
v1.0 - All vanilla weapon and armor recipes rebalanced from the following categories (Hide, Leather, Iron, Steel and Imperial)
[s]v1.01 - Temporarily removed the optional version (imperial allegiance)[/s]
v1.02 - Put the fixed optional version back in. Imperial armor un-craftable until joining the legion
v1.1 - Completed weapon and armor recipes for Dwarven and Elven (also fixed small issue with Optional version)
v1.2 - Completed Orcish and Glass (added new optional file for easier ingot crafting)
v1.3 - New Easyleather option, Completed Steelplate, Scaled, Dragonplate and Dragonscale
Also revamped all previous additions. Proper items now require the necessary Pelts to craft.
[color=yellow]ps. There are two Deer Hides in the game, I changed the name of the one that comes from Elk to Elk Hide[/color]
v1.4 - Completed Ebony and Daedric armor and weapon sets and the Ancient Nord armor set.
Also made small change to the Orcish boots recipe (I missed some Leather Strips on the backside of the Boots)

~~Compatibility~~
This mod was made with the Creation Kit alone, and only changes vanilla recipes, so should be compatible with just about anything.
As for crafting overhauls, which I am sure many of you use, this should work with them because my mod only changes current recipes where most crafting mods add new recipes in.

If you\'re not using a crafting overhaul mod then I recommend you check out my other mod [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28040/]CIA - Craftable Imperial Armory[/url]. It adds all the missing Imperial armor and weapons as well as the Stormcloak gear depending on which side you choose in the civil war. If you want to use both of my mods, check your load order.
[list]
[*]WARR.esp
[*]CIA.esp
[/list]Always load CIA after WARR so that you get the proper effect

~~Installing~~ (Manual Installers only need the Manual install Archive)
(NMM installers need to download each option as an individual extra, sorry but I don\'t know how to write a script for NMM)
This is a very simple plugin mod.
Only thing you need to do is drop the Data folder into your Skyrim folder.
Default location for Skyrim folder in a 64-bit installation is as follows.
C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\Skyrim

~~Uninstalling~~
Since this mod is so simple, you merely need to delete WARR.esp or uncheck it from your load order. (Same with all options)

~~Optionals~~ (See the ReadMe in the optionals folder for more details.)
There is an optional [color=yellow]Imperial Allegiance version[/color] which replaces the main WARR.esp with a new one. This version makes the Imperial Heavy Armor require allegiance with the Imperial Legion as well as the Steel Smithing perk in order to be crafted. (not necessary if using my other mod - CIA)

If you have difficulty finding enough Corundum for steel smithing I have included an optional plugin which changes the Steel Ingot recipe so that it requires Charcoal instead of Corundum Ore. Charcoal can also be smelted from Firewood to ease the burden of finding Charcoal.
There are two kinds of Charcoal in the game, one is the regular Charcoal commonly used by mods for crafting recipes such as this mod, and the other is a lump Coal that was incorrectly named Charcoal by Bethesda. I renamed this version of Charcoal as \"Coal\" to ease the confusion.

Easy Ingots is an option to turn each Ingot into a 1 to 1 ratio such as the Iron ingots. In other words, you only need 1 Ore to make 1 Ingot.

Easy leather doubles leather from each pelt and also doubles strips from each piece of leather.

Some of the recipes can be quite large and require a lot of resources, so you will not be crafting as many items as usual. To compensate for this you might want to gain [color=yellow]Smithing XP from Tanning Racks and Smelters[/color] by trying [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24116]This mod[/url] from AnkhAscendant. If you would like to get Smithing XP as mentioned above AND also get Alchemy XP from Cooking then check out my other mod [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28030]Cooking for Alchemy[/url] which does both in one .esp

~~FINAL NOTES~~
All armor sets have been completed as well as ALL* weapon sets in the Vanilla game. Why an asterisk on All weapons? Well, I left out the recipes for the Nord Hero weapons as you are essentially \"upgrading\" the default Draugr weapons for stronger ones. I think that is a kind of cool idea but if anyone requests it, I will add in the Nord Hero weapons or perhaps make it an optional extra.

~~Recipe List~~
Hide Armor - 5 Leather, 4 Leather Strips, 1 Iron Ingot, 1 Elk Hide and 1 Wolf Pelt
Studded Armor - 7 Leather, 4 Leather Strips, 3 Iron Ingot, 1 Elk Hide and 1 Sabrecat Hide
Hide Boots - 2 Leather, 2 Leather Strips and 1 Fox Pelt
Hide Bracers - 1 Leather and 1 Iron Ingot
Hide Helmet - 1 Leather and 1 Iron Ingot
Hide Shield - 4 Leather, 1 Leather Strips and 2 Iron Ingot
